definition: obstinately clinging to one's course (idiom)/willful/one's own way/dogmatic
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate
lone/lonely
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense

sentences.english: Olaf Martens pursues his own ideas.
sentences.chinese: 馬斯滕對自己的觀念一意孤行。

sentences.english: It's time to let your Sagittarius charm take over not your pushiness .
sentences.chinese: 是時候發揮妳射手座魅力了，不要一意孤行啊。

sentences.english: Mugabe knows he cannot go it alone.
sentences.chinese: 穆加貝明白他不能一意孤行。

sentences.english: She is always going her own way.
sentences.chinese: 對極了，她總是一意孤行。

sentences.english: If the need arises, we may even break down in tears , until our parents cannot bear to be willful anymore.
sentences.chinese: 必要時還可以聲淚俱下，讓父母不忍心一意孤行下去。

sentences.english: If you act willfully , it may do more harm than good.
sentences.chinese: 如果你一意孤行，那可能弊多利少。
太大男人的男仕，通常比較一意孤行。

sentences.english: If Japan obstinately clings to its course, it must shoulder all the responsibilities.
sentences.chinese: 如日方一意孤行，必須承擔全部責任。

sentences.english: Part of the problem is crass intransigence by the opposition.
sentences.chinese: 這也有部分原因是由於反對黨的一意孤行和毫不讓步。

definition: to persist in one's views
to be determined to/to insist on
to advise/to urge/to exhort/exhortation/advice/CL:席[xi2]
see 冒大不韙|冒大不韪[mao4 da4 bu4 wei3]
pinyin: mao4 tian1 xia4 zhi1 da4 bu4 wei3

definition: to court disaster (idiom)/to dig one's own grave
old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent
to stick to one's ways/to cling to one's course
pinyin: yi1 tiao2 dao4 zou3 dao4 hei1

definition: to let emotions affect one's decisions
to show no understanding of the times (idiom); cannot adapt to current circumstances/not amenable to reason
to continue in one's own way (idiom)
obstinate and self-opinionated (idiom)
to be determined
to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
to shield (a miscreant) from punishment, criticism etc/to take sb's side
to eat one's own fruit (idiom); fig. suffering the consequences of one's own action/to reap what one has sown
to pay no heed to (idiom)/to ignore/to brush aside
